full_text:
Managing Vendors

Lesson
objectives

* Define a shared contact

Create a vendor in ClaimCenter

Approve changes to vendors created in
ClaimCenter from ContactManager
Describe the process of linking, syncing, and
editing vendor contacts in ClaimCenter
Check for duplicate vendors in
ContactManager

Add documents and assign services to a
vendor in ContactManager

| Assigning vendors to claims

As a claims adjuster, | often assign vendors to
claims. Usually, | can select a vendor from a list of
existing vendors. However, sometimes | need to
register a new vendor.

If | know which vendor to use and they are not
recorded in the Address Book, how can | assign
them as a vendor on a claim?

Tanvi \yee
Adjuster Gasa/

V

| Review: Shared contacts

Claim 036-22-934712 ee

Dr. Matt Sawyer (1) l Sf i

Claim 000-00-002006 =>

Tanya Fan L_

D

ir. Matt Sawyer (doctor)

| Review: Claim contacts G

¢ In ClaimCenter, a claim contact is a contact with one or more roles on a claim
« May be persons or vendors

¢ Persons typically exist in ClaimCenter only

¢ Vendors exist in ContactManager and are shared with ClaimCenter

| Creating vendor contacts in ClaimCenter Gi

Vendor contacts in ClaimCenter are linked to ContactManager

Additions or changes to vendor contacts usually require approval in
ContactManager

If a vendor contact is created in ClaimCenter, it is immediately linked with
ContactManager

Vendors modified or created in ClaimCenter become pending changes in
ContactManager until approved

Adding a vendor

Claim 908-00-230166

| Managing vendors in ContactManager

ContactManager is the system of record for vendors
Vendors created in ClaimCenter (or other core product) are pending approval
New vendors and modified vendors are approved or rejected in ContactManager
Vendor managers may also make changes in ContactManager

Changes may be copied to ClaimCenter from the Contacts screen in ClaimCenter

Eicuipewire ContactManager*

Actions a
Pending Changes

Search

Updates(1) Creates (1)

Merge Contacts

Pending Changes (2)

| Demonstration G

Creating vendors

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Vendor documents

¢ Vendors in ContactManager may have documents attached «=»
*« Documents can be anything needed by the vendor
* Service level agreements
* Service order forms
* Quote templates —_
« And soon

¢ When a vendor has a role on a claim,
those documents are available on the claim _—

* The documents can then be downloaded and used by the claims adjuster

| Uploading documents Gi

1. Add documents to the vendor in ContactManager on the Documents tab
2. Update the vendor

¢« Documents are immediately available on claims -

Question

,~ — What is a shared contact?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

,~ — What is a shared contact?

¢
Ashared contact is one that exists in both ContactManager and ClaimCenter.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

_- — What differentiates ClaimCenter vendor contacts from ClaimCenter non-

Yo vendor contacts?
7

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer a

_- — What differentiates ClaimCenter vendor contacts from ClaimCenter non-
Yo vendor contacts?
¢
In ClaimCenter, vendor contacts that are edited or created require approval from a

vendor manager on the ContactManager side.

ClaimCenter vendors are linked to ContactManager whereas non-vendors are not.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

_~ — What happens when a newly created vendor contact is approved in
x ContactManager?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer a

_~ — What happens when a newly created vendor contact is approved in
¢ ContactManager?

Once a vendor manager approves a newly created vendor contact, a notification is
sent to ClaimCenter. The Parties Involved screen will show that this vendor contact is
linked to the Address Book and is in sync (unless the contact has been unlinked).

¢
¢

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — What happens when a vendor manager adds documents to a vendor
x that has a role on a claim?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer

,~ — What happens when a vendor manager adds documents to a vendor
x that has a role on a claim?

The documents are immediately available on the claim.

Gi

Question

,~ — What is the system of record for vendors?

4
¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

,~ — What is the system of record for vendors?

¢
ContactManager

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — What is one of the benefits or advantages of defining services for a

x vendor?
7

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

,~ — What is one of the benefits or advantages of defining services for a

x vendor?

Defining services provides better search capability from ClaimCenter.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Check for duplicate vendors in
ContactManager

vendor in ContactManager
